Fields.DialogueText: Myōkō, do you have a moment?
Is this about our new officer?
Yes, to replace the officer who abandoned his post.
He was a coward, a traitor to the Emperor.
That's the third officer... I'm simply trying to figure out what's going on.
What are you implying?

Fields.MenuText: Yikes. Calm down... just drop it.
You can be quite snappy at times.
Stress is damaging to morale. We need to keep our crew happy.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph.
You wouldn't understand the pressures of being a well-known heavy cruiser.
I'd assume the ongoing war against the Funayūrei has more to do with the crew's poor mood than anything I've done.
Who is this new officer, anyways?
His name is Shino. He was appointed for his fierce loyalty and hardened tactics on the battlefield.
Sounds like the right man for the job.
... Kanchou, something is wrong. I sense danger approaching.
It's a raid. Get ready.
@BATTLE
Argh. Rumours are swirling around the ship that we have a new officer.
Does this bother you?
That promotion was supposed to be mine. Myōkō promised my hard work would be recognized...
My apologies, Kohei. This officer was better qualified for the job.
B-but...
We don't decide who gets promoted. You know that. Command appoints the new officers based on merit.
Your time will come Kohei, it will.
Another empty promise.
Forgive Kohei. He's fiercely loyal to the Empire, but his temper can get the best of him.
You don't say...
He's much like me, you know.

Fields.MenuText: He's going to need to address me with more respect in the future.
I like the passion. We need more of that on this ship.
I think you rubbed off on Kohei.

Fields.DialogueText: Noted, Kanchou.
Passion can be dangerous coming from the wrong person.
Quiet, you.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Time to fight.
@BATTLE
Welcome aboard, Officer.
You may speak, Officer.
I long to serve the Empire. By the grace of our emperor, I will defend these waters against any and all threats.
Take it easy. We're just getting to know you.
They warned me of his extreme commitment to the role. Give him time, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: So, what are your strengths?
Do you ever have fun?
Have you seen many battles?

Fields.DialogueText: He's just staring.
Speak, Officer.
I serve one purpose and one purpose only.
To defend the Empire...
*ALARM*
Defend Myōkō. Eliminate the Morgana threat. Send them to the bottom of the ocean and wipe them clean from this Earth. No mercy will come to our enemies on this day.
Told you, Kanchou. He just needs a little guidance.
@BATTLE
Kanchou... you're bleeding...
It's just a scratch.
C-can I take a look?

Fields.MenuText: Who are you again?
Get off me, I'm fine.
Kiss it and make it better?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm the medical officer. I patch people up after battles.
My apologies, Kanchou. As the medical officer, I have a duty to check... I think.
I'm afraid that won't help, but as the medical officer I can offer you a bandage.
I noticed you keep writing in that book.
Oh, this? That's just my journal... I am reserved by nature, but when I write my thoughts in here, I can express myself more confidently.
Everyone has their outlet, I suppose...
All done, Kanchou...
Thank you. It feels good to vent to someone who's level-headed and not over the top...
It can be tough sometimes, being in the heat of battle, managing a crew that doesn't always see eye-to-eye...
Takura? You still here?
Where the hell did she go... ?
@BATTLE
So... Shino, what's so amazing about you that you were promoted over me?
He obeys orders.
Obeys orders, ha!
Do you have any talents? Sword fighting, hand-to-hand combat? Speak.
Kohei, leave him alone.
... I like to ski.
Wasn't expecting that.
Skiing? I love skiing. I've always wanted to give it a try.

Fields.MenuText: How do you love skiing if you've never tried it?
It's cold and dangerous.
I'll stick to the water.

Fields.DialogueText: I-I just know. It's so graceful, and yet filled with danger.
So is being at sea. Yet, here we all are.
Suit yourself. The mountains are a wonderful place to visit.
So, the new executive officer... can ski. That really tells us a lot about him.
What's his deal?
He's hot-tempered. I see a lot of myself in him...
*ALARM*
Damn it, Morgana strike.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, the last attack did affect our crew.
Anyone injured?
A few of the crew are in critical condition. These constant Funayūrei ambushes are getting on my nerves.
Does someone need medical attention?
Where did you even come from?
I was walking by and I overheard... I apologize for stepping in.
It's okay, Takura. There are some injured heading toward the sickbay. They'll need your help.
Anything for you, Myōkō...
She's a strange one...
What do you mean, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Why is she so awkward?
Where is she from?
How do you feel about Takura?

Fields.DialogueText: She's not much for words, that's all.
She's an orphan from Kyoto. I heard her parents died in a house fire while she was at school.
I've known her for some time now. Takura brings honor to the Empire.
I see...
Hehe. It's kind of cute when something is bothering you.
I-It wasn't like that...
@BATTLE
I figured a talented Belle such as yourself could handle the Funayūrei threat.
What are you trying to say?
Let's just say you're not as sharp as you used to be. These attacks have taken their toll on this old ship.
Kohei, that isn't fair...
Hold it together, Myōkō, hold it together...
She's going to blow.
Everyone, take it easy.
If I had her authority, we wouldn't find ourselves constantly facing battle after battle.
B-but Myōkō is the ship. It's not like you could understand what she goes through.
Oh, now you decide to talk?

Fields.MenuText: Kohei, leave her alone. You're out of line.
We should listen to Kohei more. His heart is in the right place.
As Captain, I call the shots. It sounds like you're questioning my leadership.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Kanchou...
Your support means a lot to me, Kanchou.
Never, sir...
Okay, I'm calm now.
It's just too bad that I can't assume control of this ship. I could do far better.
Oh? You "could" do better? You don't know what it's like.
If the Empire could see what an arrogant jerk you are, I'm sure they would have a different opinion of you.
Yeah. What she said...
I serve the Emperor and no one else.
*ALARM*
We're on the same side, everyone. Direct that anger at the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Kanchou. Officer Shino was just showing me proper form on my skis.
It strikes me as odd that you would have skis despite being nowhere near a mountain.
The more I wear them, the more confident I become. The thought of racing downhill used to frighten me, but now I'm excited.
Your grace will serve you well on the mountainside.
So, you do speak.
One day, I'd like to travel to my namesake and conquer the slopes there. What do you think, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Wait, you were named after a mountain?
I would never bet against you, Myōkō.
You might be better served by sticking to what you know...

Fields.DialogueText: It's my namesake, and that's how I know skiing is my calling. The heart knows where it belongs, and I refuse to ignore it.
You're so kind to me, Kanchou.
Hmph!
What do the other Belles think of your ambition?
Well, my sisters - Nachi, Haguro and Ashigara - think I'm a bit crazy. They are so conservative, sometimes...
*ALARM*
We're under attack. Let us unite against our foes and crush them under the mighty hand of the Empire.
What he said.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, do you have a minute?
What is it, Kanchou?
Tell me more about your sisters. I haven't heard you speak much about them.
I care for them as they care for me. They mean as much to me as the Empire does. In times of war, I call on my sisters' strength to remind me of my Buddhist principles.
How does being a warship and a Buddhist work, in your experience?
What are you trying to say?

Fields.MenuText: How can you be both? Don't they conflict with one another?
Nothing...
I know that, at times, principles must be set aside in times of conflict.

Fields.DialogueText: My loyalty to the Emperor comes first, as I have sworn an oath of service.
My loyalty to the Emperor comes first, as I have sworn an oath of service.
I'm glad you see my dilemma.
Thank you for talking to me, Kanchou. Not many people have taken an interest in my personal life.
You're a valuable member of my crew, Myōkō. It's important I understand how you operate.
Hmm... I sense danger approaching.
Well then, let's take them out.
@BATTLE
You're hurt, Officer Shino.
Let me patch you up.
You took quite the hit, Shino.
I would die for Myōkō.
That's not necessary. Not today, at least.
Her hair flows like the ocean current. I hope to marry a woman of her stature, one day.
Oh...

Fields.MenuText: I never took you for the romantic type.
Myōkō's your superior, Officer. Remember that.
Get in line.

Fields.DialogueText: Apologies, Kanchou.
There's a line? Who's in this line?
Leave Myōkō alone. She's a vital member of the ship's crew and she ought not be gawked at.
Takura isn't wrong.
Hmm... Point taken.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I noticed the crew have been putting less effort in their defensive drills since Officer Shino arrived.
He's been focusing on combat drills for the constant Morgana attacks.
We are required to be trained in both areas. He's not fit to be an officer. When will you realize this, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: That's not for you to decide.
Your envy of Shino is causing problems.
Focus on bettering yourself. If you make the effort, I'm sure a promotion will come your way soon enough.

Fields.DialogueText: If only the Empire could see the truth... that I'm the one for this job.
Envy? Me? Ha! I only want what's best for the Empire.
Better myself? I'm the strongest, fastest, and most fearless in my rank.
What do you want me to do, exactly?
Tell your superiors that Officer Shino is failing in his duties. Tell them he isn't fit for the role.
I'm not starting anything with Officer Shino.
*ALARM*
Fine, then I will.
This is just what I need...
@BATTLE
Officer Shino, do you care to explain why we've been lacking in our defensive drills?
That's none of your concern, Kohei.
The hell it is. The safety of my friends is my only concern, and you're jeopardizing that.
Guys, please...
Takura is right. Stop this pointless squabble.
Kohei has had issues with me since I came on board.
Because you have the personality of a dead fish and your strategies are outdated.
Insult me again and see how it plays out.
Seriously, stop. I can't handle all this fighting... I just can't...
Don't be such a baby, Takura.

Fields.MenuText: Listen to Takura. We're a team and our enemies are the Morganas. Don't lose sight of that.
Officer Shino is right. Kohei, you have been out of control lately, and it needs to end.
Kohei is right. Officer Shino, the crew must undergo defensive drills as well as offensive.

Fields.DialogueText: W-wow, I wasn't expecting to win that one...
They're both in the wrong.
They're both in the wrong.
I apologize, Takura. I didn't mean to blow up on you.
It's okay... I only want to help.
Kohei, can you make an effort to get along with Officer Shino?
Damn it. Fine... I'll back off. I'm keeping my eye on him, though.
*ALARM*
Prepare the guns. The Empire must prevail.
You have a lunatic for an officer.
Drop it, Kohei. It's time to fight.
@BATTLE
Myōkō... I brought you a gift.
Is that... is that poppo-yaki?
Poppo... what?
Don't tell me you've never tried poppo-yaki. Steamed bread with brown sugar?
I know it's your favorite...

Fields.MenuText: There's much to learn about you, Myōkō.
It needs more meat.
That looks delicious. Can I have a bite?

Fields.DialogueText: And I'd be happy to tell you, Kanchou.
Buddhists don't eat meat, silly.
Let me think about it... no.
Nothing makes me happier than making you happy, Myōkō...
Damn it. Funayūrei are on the horizon. Looks like my poppo-yaki will have to wait.
I hope no one eats it...
Don't even mention such a thing!
@BATTLE
Officer, you're hurt..
It's only a scratch.
Looks like more than a scratch. You should check in with Takura.
Honestly, I'm fine...
Listen, you hardhead. The kanchou told you to get medical attention. What part of that don't you understand?
Easy, Kohei.

Fields.MenuText: It's for the sake of caution, Shino.
I refuse to let you walk around like that.
Listen to your commanding officer.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose you are correct...
It does hurt...
My apologies, Kanchou.
Don't worry, Kanchou. I'll escort him to medical personally.
Thank you, Kohei.
@BATTLE
Kohei, have a moment?
What is it?
How is Officer Shino doing? Did you take him to Takura?
I started to, but he kept getting on my nerves. We argued, and I stormed off. Haven't seen him since.

Fields.MenuText: I gave you a direct order.
Will you two ever get along?
He's grown up enough to go on his own, I suppose.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, but he can handle himself. That's why he's an officer, isn't it?
Probably not. But he is my superior and I'm learning to cope with that.
He is...
I'm going to see how he's doing.
*ALARM*
I think we have more pressing matters to attend to.
To battle.
@BATTLE
Takura?
Kanchou! How can I help?
How was Shino? Did you manage to patch him up?
What do you mean, Kanchou?
Is he okay?
I'm sorry Kanchou, I don't know what you're talking about. I haven't seen Officer Shino lately.

Fields.MenuText: But he was supposed to come see you, by my orders.
You're lying.
Then where the hell is he?

Fields.DialogueText: Again, I don't know. Maybe he thought he didn't need medical attention?
W-why would I lie? I love my job. Helping people brings me joy.
Might you try Myōkō?
Something isn't adding up here... I'm going to get to the bottom of this.
*ALARM*
I wish I could have been more help...
It's okay, Takura. Thank you. Now, I have Morganas to deal with.
@BATTLE
Myōkō?
Oh! Kanchou, you scared me.
Have you seen Officer Shino?
Not for a while, now that you mention it. What's going on?
That's what I'm trying to figure out.
Well, he didn't just disappear.

Fields.MenuText: Have you noticed any strange behavior from Shino lately?
Do you think Kohei had something to do with this?
Takura hasn't seen him, but I ordered him to check in with her. It's not like him to disobey orders.

Fields.DialogueText: Strange? Officer Shino? I think the two go hand-in-hand. Really, everyone aboard this ship is a little odd.
They had their differences, but Kohei is loyal to the Empire above all.
Maybe Officer Shino had a bad day?
This is all a little unnerving. He's nowhere to be found.
I hate to interrupt, but Funayūrei are approaching.
Damnit.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! You have to read this. It's about Officer Shino...
A note?
I went looking for him, and, and... I found it under his bed. A suicide note.
A suicide note? H-he's dead?
It says he is... was? ... infatuated with... Myōkō? He decided to take his life... so he can join her in the afterlife.
With me? Shino? What is going on... ?
There's more. We're all in grave danger.
It says one way or another she will join him in the afterlife soon...
Does that mean... ?
What has he done?!

Fields.MenuText: Myōkō, my priority is to keep you safe no matter what.
There could be a trap set on board.
How could he do this?

Fields.DialogueText: Arigato... I know I can rely on you, Kanchou.
How could he? None of this makes sense.
It's not in his character to do something like this.
Hate to say I told you so... but that man was a fraud.
He's not a fraud. He took his life. Show some respect.
Everyone, be on alert. We don't know what he was planning and we might all be in danger.
*ALARM*
Not the best time for a Funayūrei attack.
When is it ever?
@BATTLE
I can't get over Officer Shino. It doesn't make sense...
I don't know... You both had a love for skiing in common. Maybe there was something he felt that we didn't see.
He was supposed to teach me how to ski. Not develop this strange... infatuation with me.
That's another officer that's gone missing. Do you sense a trend here?
What are you trying to say?

Fields.MenuText: That there's something deeper we need to look at, here.
Maybe you should limit your interactions with the crew for the time being.
We need to make sure everyone on board is being completely honest.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, at this point I'm up for any ideas.
And do what? Sit alone on the deck and stare at the water?
This crew has been with us through thick and thin. It doesn't make sense for any of them to betray us.
Be very cautious of the conversations you have going forward. We need to catch any anomalies that come through.
Kuso! Speaking of anomalies...
Morganas?
Mmhmm.
@BATTLE
Ouch.
Hold still. That cut on your arm is deep.
It's fine. Stop being dramatic.
Hey, how are you both holding up?
I'm fine.
I'm a little shaken... this is all a little... well, frightening.

Fields.MenuText: I need answers on Shino. Now.
Kohei, you know how this looks, don't you? You were supposed to escort Shino to Takura.
Takura, are you sure he didn't say anything to you? Nothing?

Fields.DialogueText: You saw the note. What more needs to be said?
So I made him commit suicide because we didn't get along?
There's no sense in asking Takura. She didn't see him. Officer Shino lost his mind and he gave up. End of story.
I'm not suggesting anything. Just want to make sure I have all the facts. It just didn't seem to be in Shino's nature to take his own life.
I can only hope it's just that and not something more...
The real question is, did he plant some kind of trap to destroy us?
L-like what?
Oh I don't know... a bomb?
Eek!
That's enough. There's no sense in spreading false rumors.
You read his note. I'm going to find out one way or another.
Y-you really think there's a trap set?
Don't listen to Kohei, Takura.
*ALARM*
Besides, we have more immediate concerns.
@BATTLE
Kanchou?
What is it, Myōkō?
I received word from Command regarding Officer Shino's disappearance.
Go on...
They are investigating the matter and will be appointing a new officer, one who is capable of defending him or herself.

Fields.MenuText: An investigation on top of the constant Morgana attacks? Great...
Kohei is deserving of the promotion.
Takura?

Fields.DialogueText: Command wants to sort this out, and I support them with all my being.
He is a little unhinged, but strong nonetheless.
She's an incredible nurse, but an officer she is not.
Kanchou...
What?
I-I feel as if it's difficult to know who to trust aboard this ship... but, I know I can rely on you.
That's good, Myōkō. I only want what's best for the ship, and that starts with you.
Do you think after this is over, I don't know... maybe we could find some way of skiing... together?
Myōkō...
*ALARM*
Perfect timing...
@BATTLE
Kohei, I have news from Command.
Yes, Kanchou?
You are to take over Officer Shino's position, effective immediately.
An investigation is being launched into Shino's disappearance. Your promotion will remain intact, provided you had nothing to do with this entire situation.
Finally! I've been working so hard for this moment. I will never betray the Empire or Command, and I swear my undying loyalty to this ship and to the Empire.
Goodness. Congratulations, Kohei...

Fields.MenuText: Here's your chance to be the officer you claim you can be. Don't mess this up.
Command has high hopes for you. I'm still waiting to see what you're capable of.
Are you prepared to make tough decisions? Some that will affect your crew directly?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Kanchou.
I'll stop at nothing to prove I belong in this position, Kanchou.
I was born ready.
I'll go announce the news to the crew. Arigato, Kanchou.
I-I don't want to sound negative, but... do you think Kohei had anything to do with Shino's death?
You bring this up right after he's promoted to officer?
Gomen nasai, Kanchou... it's just that they never got along, and you said yourself he was supposed to escort Shino to see me but never arrived.
Now that he's been promoted? All of this just seems to have worked out very well in his favor.
Command will figure it out. In the meantime, we need to keep our wits about us.
H-hai, Kanchou. My apologies.
Keep this conversation between us.
*ALARM*
I won't say a word...
@BATTLE
I discovered something.
What is it, Takura?
I was digging around and I found this.
It's a letter from Shino, addressed to... his daughter?
But look - the writing is different from that on his suicide note.
She's right. If that's the case, who wrote his suicide note?

Fields.MenuText: We need to cross-check the writing of everyone on board.
Kohei...
There's a murderer on this ship. Everyone is a suspect... even you.

Fields.DialogueText: Good idea, Kanchou.
Let's not jump to conclusions.
Me? Ha! Don't make me laugh.
I'm scared...
Radio Command. We'll figure out who is behind this.
*ALARM*
It seems to be just as dangerous out there as it is in here...
@BATTLE
Kohei... I made a card to send away to Shino's family.
Cute. We have Funayūrei attacking around every corner and you're making cards.
Kohei...
Because I care. Now, just write something in here. Anything.
I know what you're up to. Don't take me for some kind of fool.
W-what do you mean?
Rumor has it that Shino has a daughter and the writing doesn't match the suicide note. Now you're trying to find out whose writing it was, huh?
I would never.
You want my writing? Just ask. But don't tiptoe around behind my back trying to pin this on me. I have a duty to uphold to the Empire, and you're jeopardizing that.
Easy, we're just taking precautions.
I won't stand for this. When the INPF sends someone to investigate, the truth will be known.

Fields.MenuText: If you're innocent, then you have nothing to lose by cooperating.
You sound more guilty every second.
Takura, you're in the wrong. Stop this witch hunt immediately.

Fields.DialogueText: It's the principle, Kanchou.
Then go ahead and have me arrested.
Finally, someone who sees the light.
Someone is going around killing members of our crew, and if we keep up like this, we're never going to find them.
I've had it. I'll do my duties, but otherwise, I don't want to see any of you.
Kanchou, have you considered everyone who could have been involved? I mean...  everyone?
Who are you accusing?
How much do you really know about Takura?
*ALARM*
I can't believe that she would ever do such a thing. Now, let's focus on eliminating the Morganas.
Music to my ears...
@BATTLE
(Maybe sorting this all out is going to take more time than I thought...)
Myōkō? What are you doing?
Shining my skis so I can practice my form. How do I look?
You look... like you've been skiing your whole life.
Hee... Stop, you're making me blush.
I've been giving some thought to your earlier proposal. About skiing once the war is over.
Really? Well... out with it!
"Out with it"? You sound excited, Myōkō.
Hai! Will you come? You know you want to...

Fields.MenuText: I have a feeling I'll be ready for a vacation once this is all over. Yes, I will go skiing with you.
Honestly, Myōkō, I think I'd follow you anywhere.
